page.title: 01PENNINES - WEST OF RIPON
page.content: The block is typical of the changing landscape as the farmland of the York plain gradually merges into the hill farming country and heather grouse moors of the Pennines. Sheep and cattle grazing predominate. There is no arable farming. Fields are small usually enclosed by dry stone walls. Farm buildings are small, usually sited in such a way as to be protected, as far as possible, from the severe winter weather. A small reservoir, managed by the Yorkshire Water Authority, is supplied by small streams running off the heather moors to the west, the small hamlet of Grantley comprises approximately 12 houses, one public house, one primary school, one chapel, telephone box and post box. Coniferous and deciduous trees abound. There us a small wood yard.
